body_html:
The C_API is easy to understand. It is an issue of writing in C such that the LOC is very large. But it is pretty straightforward to restore a graph in different languages.

These examples for C,C++,Go work. Instead of wasting time by reading "tutorials", reading the TF source is more helpful. You probably cannot write a a small guide for loading a graph in C.

There is only one way of restoring a graph. The other stuff is syntactic sugar. In your issue description your probably confuse restoring a graph vs. restoring parameters.

body:
The C_API is easy to understand. It is an issue of writing in C such that the LOC is very large. But it is pretty straightforward to restore a graph in different languages.

[These examples for C,C++,Go](https://github.com/PatWie/tensorflow_inference) work. Instead of wasting time by reading "tutorials", reading the TF source is more helpful. You probably cannot write a a small guide for loading a graph in C.

There is only one way of restoring a graph. The other stuff is syntactic sugar. In your issue description your probably confuse restoring a graph vs. restoring parameters.
